title: Zachary T. Rewolinski
text:
zachrewolinski@berkeley.edu
  
  
    
     zachrewolinski
  
  
      Zachary T. Rewolinski
  
  
    
     Zachary Rewolinski
  

  
  
I am a second-year PhD student in the Department of Statistics at UC Berkeley, advised by Bin Yu.
My research is primarily focused on ensuring that machine learning models are trustworthy of making real-world decisions in high-impact fields such as finance, medicine, criminal justice, and more. My research is supported by the NSF Graduate Research Fellowship.
I graduated from Rice University in 2023 with a B.S. in Statistics, a B.S. in Computer Science, and a B.A. in Mathematics. While at Rice, I was fortunate to work with Genevera Allen.

title: Publications
text:
A Low-Rank Tensor Completion Approach for Imputing Functional Neuronal Data from Multiple Recordings (2022) Lili Zheng, Zachary T. Rewolinski, Genevera I. Allen IEEE Data Science and Learning Workshop (DSLW)

Presentations
COVID-19 Policy Impacts on NO2, Ozone, and PM2.5 Levels in U.S. Cities (2021) Y. Choi, H. Louh, D. Cohan, D. Kowal, Z. Rewolinski, A. Nguyen, J. Li, A. Dayan, A. Abbott American Meteorological Society (AMS) Annual Meeting, Poster Presentation.
Responses of human activity & in-situ & satellite-observed air quality in U.S. cities to the COVID pandemic (2020) D. Cohan, D. Kowal, Y. Choi, J. Li, H. Louh, R. MacDonald, G. Meriano, A. Nguyen, L. Niu, Z. Rewolinski American Geophysical Union (AGU) Fall Meeting, Oral Presentation.
COVID-19 Policy Impacts on NO2, Ozone, and PM2.5 Levels in U.S. Cities (2020) H. Louh, Y. Choi, J. Li, A. Nguyen, Z. Rewolinski, D. Kowal, D. Cohan American Geophysical Union (AGU) Fall Meeting, Poster Presentation.
Impacts of COVID-19 Pandemic on Activity and Emissions (2020) Z. Rewolinski, J. Li, A. Nguyen, D. Cohan, D. Kowal Community Modeling and Analysis Systems (CMAS) Conference, Oral Presentation.
An Analysis of the Relationship Between Pitcher Size and UCL Tears (2019) Z. Rewolinski Society for American Baseball Research (SABR) National Convention, Poster Presentation. - Best Poster Award
